content.description: You have to try this! 20 ft (aprox) problem along the prominent arete on Lange's Boulder could potentially traverse from one side of the stream to the other. Starts on the the far east corner of the boulder (sit start) and traverses along the arete until you reach a oval shaped large grey stone I nick named the rhino horn, It may be possible to keep climbing along the arete until you reach the far side of the stream  but the rock looks sketchy so I usually just top out there.
content.protection: To protect this route completely it could take up to 5 pads and a lot of work making a stick platform to keep your pads from being directly in the stream. This climb is all about having a good spotter who's willing to stand in the steam as you climb
content.location: North side of Lange's Boulder. Look at the pictures
